definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Each ace of kylin daredevil gathered in the interview venue.
sentences.chinese: 各家好手齐聚的麒麟艺高的面试会场。

sentences.english: 'I was a pretty good swimmer myself when I was a young man,' I said.
sentences.chinese: ‘本人年轻时也是个游泳好手，’我说。

sentences.english: I lost a good man here . What the fuck do you want with me?
sentences.chinese: 在这儿我损失了一个好手你他妈的想让我怎么办？

sentences.english: And I congratulate him on being the best at what he does.
sentences.chinese: 我对他成为自己领域里的顶尖好手表示祝贺。

sentences.english: Kiss the dice for good luck.
sentences.chinese: 为了好手气亲一下色子吧。

sentences.english: He was a good story-teller and used to make up tales about farmers and animals.
sentences.chinese: 他是个讲故事的好手，常编一些农夫和动物的故事。

sentences.english: True, some elite marathoners do run sans sneakers.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有些马拉松好手确实穿胶底运动鞋跑步。

sentences.english: Yi could also prove a nice recruiting tool.
sentences.chinese: 易建联还将证明他是个招财进宝的好手。

sentences.english: One of the best man-to-man markers in the English game.
sentences.chinese: 本次英国赛事中最佳的盯人好手之一。

sentences.english: It is said to be a tree climber, but often stands on the ground in a bipedal stance.
sentences.chinese: 据说它是爬树好手，但是却经常以两足站立。

sentences.english: I thought you'd be hopeless, but you're a natural.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始我以为你根本没救，但妳真是天生好手。

sentences.english: Good hagglers are always upbeat, polite and patient.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手通常都是乐观欢快，礼貌和耐心的。

sentences.english: He is a champion at writing familiar essays.
"You'll do, " Joe answered. "You take hold like a good fellow.
sentences.chinese: “你能成，”乔回答，“你很肯干，真像把好手。

sentences.english: A good haggler knows when to walk away empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手清楚什么时候空手而归。
做针线活儿，她可是把好手。

definition: to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
experienced person/an old hand at sth
(politics) strongman/(in the workplace, esp. of a woman) a highly capable person/(old) robber
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
